diamonds.title: Round Brilliant Diamond
diamonds.note: Round Brilliant diamonds are precision cut to maximize light return and fire. With 57–58 facets, this cut offers the highest brilliance and remains the most liquid and investment-stable diamond shape worldwide.

diamonds.title: Oval Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Oval cut diamonds combine brilliant sparkle with elongated elegance, giving a larger face-up appearance per carat and refined luxury aesthetics.

diamonds.title: Emerald Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Emerald cut diamonds feature long step facets that highlight clarity and symmetry, producing an elegant hall-of-mirrors effect preferred by collectors.

diamonds.title: Pear Shape Diamond
diamonds.note: Pear diamonds blend round brilliance with marquise elegance, creating graceful tear-drop silhouettes ideal for pendants and fashion-forward rings.

diamonds.title: Marquise Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Marquise diamonds maximize surface area and visual size, producing dramatic brilliance and bold elongated profiles.

diamonds.title: Princess Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Princess cut diamonds deliver sharp brilliance and modern square geometry, making them a popular choice for contemporary engagement rings.

diamonds.title: Radiant Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Radiant cut diamonds combine brilliant and step facets, producing intense sparkle while maintaining crisp rectangular elegance.

diamonds.title: Cushion Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Cushion cut diamonds feature rounded corners and large facets, producing soft romantic brilliance with timeless appeal.

sapphires.title: Cornflower Blue Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Cornflower blue sapphires are valued for their soft velvety blue tone and excellent transparency. They are highly demanded in both fine jewellery and Vedic astrology.

sapphires.title: Royal Blue Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Royal blue sapphires show deep saturated blue with strong brilliance, making them premium stones for luxury settings.

sapphires.title: Deep Blue Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Madagascar sapphires provide rich deep tone with excellent brilliance and are widely used in premium jewellery.

sapphires.title: Kashmir Type Blue Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Kashmir-type sapphires are famous for their velvety cornflower appearance and command premium collector value.

sapphires.title: Pear Cut Blue Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Pear shaped sapphires provide elegant brilliance and are popular for pendants and bespoke jewellery designs.

sapphires.title: Pink Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Pink sapphires offer vibrant saturation and excellent durability for fine designer jewellery.

sapphires.title: Purple Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Purple sapphires display royal hues with strong durability suitable for luxury rings and pendants.

sapphires.title: Lavender Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Lavender sapphires offer soft pastel elegance with excellent brilliance and durability.

sapphires.title: Padparadscha Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Padparadscha sapphires are extremely rare, displaying a unique lotus-flower color blend highly prized by collectors.

sapphires.title: Parti Color Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Parti sapphires naturally show two or more colors within one crystal, making each stone completely unique.

sapphires.title: Orange Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Orange sapphires are rare and highly vibrant, suitable for statement jewellery pieces.

sapphires.title: Yellow Sapphire – Pukhraj (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Yellow sapphires are highly valued in astrology and are worn for prosperity and career growth.

sapphires.title: Green Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Green sapphires are rare and provide unique earthy elegance with excellent durability.

sapphires.title: Emerald Cut Green Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Step cut enhances clarity and elegant zoning of natural green sapphire crystals.

sapphires.title: Teal Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Teal sapphires blend blue and green hues, trending strongly in contemporary fine jewellery.

sapphires.title: Teal Sapphire Radiant Cut (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Radiant cut enhances brilliance while maintaining strong teal saturation.

sapphires.title: White Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: White sapphires are durable diamond alternatives with excellent sparkle and affordability.

sapphires.title: Star Blue Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Star sapphires display six-rayed star effect under light caused by rutile inclusions.

sapphires.title: Cabochon Blue Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Cabochon sapphires highlight body color and natural crystal character without facets.

sapphires.title: Emerald Cut Navy Blue Sapphire (Neelam)
sapphires.note: Deep navy sapphires in step cut provide refined luxury with elegant facet symmetry.

rubies.title: Pigeon Blood Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Pigeon Blood rubies display the most intense vivid red with slight bluish undertone and natural fluorescence. These are the most valuable rubies in the global gemstone market.

rubies.title: Burmese Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Untreated Burmese rubies are highly prized for natural crystal structure and intense saturation without enhancement.

rubies.title: Burmese Round Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Round Burmese rubies provide balanced brilliance and uniform saturation suitable for fine jewellery.

rubies.title: Mozambique Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Mozambique rubies are known for excellent clarity and bright red color rivaling Burmese stones in fine grades.

rubies.title: Madagascar Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Madagascar rubies offer bright tone with good transparency at competitive luxury pricing.

rubies.title: Heated Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Heat treatment improves color and clarity while preserving natural gemstone origin.

rubies.title: Untreated Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Untreated rubies are highly valued due to natural untouched crystal structure and rarity.

rubies.title: Pear Cut Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Pear cut rubies provide elegant silhouettes ideal for luxury pendants and designer settings.

rubies.title: Emerald Cut Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Step cut ruby emphasizes crystal clarity and deep saturated red tone for elegant jewellery.

rubies.title: Marquise Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Marquise rubies create dramatic elongated brilliance suitable for bold luxury designs.

rubies.title: Heart Cut Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Heart shaped rubies are rare novelty cuts valued for romantic bespoke jewellery pieces.

rubies.title: Star Ruby (Manik)
rubies.note: Star rubies show natural six-rayed star under direct light due to rutile inclusions.

emeralds.title: Colombian Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Colombian emeralds are world-famous for their intense saturated green color and fine crystal transparency, making them the benchmark for premium emerald quality.

emeralds.title: Zambian Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Zambian emeralds display cooler bluish green tones with higher clarity compared to Colombian stones, preferred for modern jewellery.

emeralds.title: Brazilian Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Brazilian emeralds offer softer lighter green shades and are popular for elegant jewellery designs.

emeralds.title: Pear Cut Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Pear shaped emeralds combine elegance with excellent light return for luxury pendants.

emeralds.title: Round Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Round emeralds provide balanced brilliance and are suitable for everyday fine jewellery settings.

emeralds.title: Cabochon Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Cabochon emeralds highlight natural body color and crystal character, widely used in astrology rings.

emeralds.title: Vintage Emerald Cut Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.short: Vintage Emerald Cut · Deep Green · Colombia
emeralds.note: Vintage emerald cuts feature classic proportions preferred by collectors for timeless elegance.

emeralds.title: Light Green Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Commercial grade emeralds offer natural green color suitable for everyday jewellery at accessible pricing.

emeralds.title: Deep Green Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Forest green emeralds from Zambia offer strong saturation with good crystal structure for premium settings.

emeralds.title: Investment Grade Emerald (Panna)
emeralds.note: Top grade emeralds with strong transparency and saturated green color are preferred by investors and collectors.
